intro: Brownea antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian brownea, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the Andes Mountains. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
